dt: {bc}having or showing realization, perception, or knowledge

dt.t: {wi}aware{/wi} of the latest advances in medicine

pt: {sc}aware{/sc} {sc}cognizant{/sc} {sc}conscious{/sc} {sc}sensible{/sc} {sc}alive{/sc} {sc}awake{/sc} mean having knowledge of something. {sc}aware{/sc} implies vigilance in observing or alertness in drawing inferences from what one experiences.
{sc}cognizant{/sc} implies having special or certain knowledge as from firsthand sources.
{sc}conscious{/sc} implies that one is focusing one's attention on something or is even preoccupied by it.
{sc}sensible{/sc} implies direct or intuitive perceiving especially of intangibles or of emotional states or qualities.
{sc}alive{/sc} adds to {sc}sensible{/sc} the implication of acute sensitivity to something.
{sc}awake{/sc} implies that one has become alive to something and is on the alert.

pt.t: a country always {it}awake{/it} to the threat of invasion

et: Middle English {it}iwar, iwarre,{/it} going back to Old English {it}gewær,{/it} going back to West Germanic {it}*gawaro-{/it} (whence Old Saxon & Old High German {it}giwar{/it} "cognizant"), from {it}*ga-,{/it} perfective, associative and collective prefix + Germanic {it}*waro-{/it} "cognizant, watchful" {ma}{mat|co-|}, {mat|ware:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: having or showing realization, perception, or knowledge

dt.t: But Ms. Wurtzel herself is {wi}hyperaware{/wi} of the narcissistic nature of her problems …
